intro: Elaphoglossum antioquianum, commonly known as the Antioquian holly fern, is a species of fern native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, thriving in the understory of tropical forests. Its spore-bearing structures, called sori, are located on the underside of the fronds. Elaphoglossum antioquianum plays a vital role in its ecosystem by contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for various microorganisms.
